Composed by KÄtyÄyanÄ«putra
Tripiá¹­aka master Saá¹ƒghadeva of KaÅ›mÄ«ra during the Fu Qin

The third chapter on seeing the truth in the four great treatises, in the section on seeing the truth. The World-Honored One's disciples who have accomplished seeing the truth but have not yet eliminated desire for the form realm, and who have accomplished the precepts of body and speech related to the form realm, what four great elements does that form consist of?

Those born in the desire realm who enter the first concentration with outflows, and enter the second, third, and fourth concentrations with outflows, what four great elements does the form of their precepts of body and speech consist of?

Those born in the desire realm who enter the first concentration without outflows, and enter the second, third, and fourth concentrations without outflows, what four great elements does the form of their precepts of body and speech consist of?

Those born in the form realm who enter the first concentration with outflows, and enter the second, third, and fourth concentrations with outflows, what four great elements does the form of their precepts of body and speech consist of?

When one born in the form realm enters the first formless concentration without outflows, and enters the second, third, and fourth formless concentrations without outflows, what four great elements does the form of their bodily and verbal precepts belong to?
When the disciples of the World-Honored One are born in the formless realm, what four great elements does the form of the bodily and verbal precepts they accomplish without outflows belong to?
When one who has passed away from the formless realm is first born in the desire realm and obtains the four great elements, what four great elements are the cause of those four great elements?
When one who has passed away from the formless realm is first born in the form realm and obtains the four great elements, what four great elements are the cause of those four great elements?

When one who has passed away from the form realm is first born in the desire realm and obtains the four great elements, what four great elements are the cause of those four great elements?ğŸ”½When one born in the desire realm manifests form belonging to the form realm and speaks words of the form realm, what four great elements does that form belong to?
When one born in the form realm manifests the desire realm and speaks words of the desire realm, what four great elements does that form belong to?
Should transformation be said to have the four great elements or not have the four great elements?
Should it be said to have derivative form or not have derivative form?
Should it be said to have mind or not have mind?
Should it be said to be using whose mind and speech?
Should the intermediate state be said to be the four great elements or not the four great elements?
Should it be said to be derivative form or not derivative form?
Should it be said to have mind or be without mind?
Should it be said to be using whose mind and speech?ğŸ”½What is the name of the distant past?
What is the name of an eon?
What is the name of the arising, abiding, and ceasing of the mind?
Are there any dharmas that arise from four conditions, three conditions, two conditions, or one condition?
What are the dharmas that are associated with causes?
What are the dharmas that are not associated with causes?ğŸ”½What are the dharmas that are both associated with causes and not associated with causes?
What are the dharmas that are neither associated with causes nor not associated with causes?
What are the dharmas that are shared as objects?
What are the dharmas that are not shared as objects?ğŸ”½What are the dharmas that are both shared and not shared as objects?
What are the dharmas that are neither shared nor not shared as objects?
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
Internally without the notion of form, observing forms externally.
How does one have no internal form conception but observe forms externally?
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
There is formless conception.
What is formless conception?
All those with formless conception have exhausted desire for form.
If one has exhausted desire for form, do they all have formless conception?ğŸ”½Those without formless conception have not yet exhausted desire for form.
If one has not exhausted desire for form, do they all not have formless conception?
The four bases of consciousness and the seven bases of consciousness, are the four bases of consciousness included in the seven bases of consciousness?
Are the seven bases of consciousness included in the four bases of consciousness?
The four bases of consciousness and the nine abodes of beings, are the four bases of consciousness included in the nine abodes of beings?
Are the nine abodes of beings included in the four bases of consciousness?
The seven bases of consciousness and the nine abodes of beings, are the seven bases of consciousness included in the nine abodes of beings?
Are the nine abodes of beings included in the seven bases of consciousness?
I wish to hear a full explanation of the meaning of this chapter.

The World-Honored One's disciples who have attained insight and have not yet eliminated desire for the form realm possess bodily and verbal precepts in the form realm. What four great elements do those forms rely on?
Answer:
They rely on the form realm.

Those born in the desire realm who enter the first concentration with outflows, and enter the second, third, and fourth concentrations with outflows, possess bodily and verbal precepts. What four great elements do those forms rely on?
Answer:
They rely on the form realm.

Those born in the desire realm who enter the first concentration without outflows, and enter the second, third, and fourth concentrations without outflows, possess bodily and verbal precepts. What four great elements do those forms rely on?
Answer:
They rely on the desire realm.

Those born in the form realm who enter the first concentration with outflows, and enter the second, third, and fourth concentrations with outflows, possess bodily and verbal precepts. What four great elements do those forms rely on?
Answer:
They rely on the form realm.

If one born in the form realm enters the first formless concentration without outflows, and enters the second, third, and fourth formless concentrations without outflows, what four great elements does the form of their bodily and verbal precepts belong to?
Answer:
It belongs to the form realm.
If the disciples of the World-Honored One are born in the formless realm, what four great elements does the form of the bodily and verbal precepts they accomplish without outflows belong to?
Answer:
It may belong to the desire realm or the form realm.
If one falls from the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm, what four great elements does the first set of four great elements they obtain belong to?
Answer:
It belongs to the desire realm.
If one falls from the formless realm and is reborn in the form realm, what four great elements does the first set of four great elements they obtain belong to?
Answer:
It belongs to the form realm.
If one falls from the form realm and is reborn in the desire realm, what four great elements does the first set of four great elements they obtain belong to?
Answer:
It belongs to the desire realm.
If one born in the desire realm manifests a form belonging to the form realm and speaks a form belonging to the form realm, what four great elements does that form belong to?
Answer:
It belongs to the form realm.
When one born in the form realm manifests a desire realm emanation and speaks a desire realm language, what four great elements does that form belong to?
Answer:
It belongs to the desire realm.
Should emanations be said to be the four great elements or not the four great elements?
Answer:
Emanations should be said to be the four great elements.
Should they be said to be form derived from the great elements or not form derived from the great elements?
Answer:
They should be said to be form derived from the great elements.
Should they be said to have mind or be mindless?
Answer:
They are mindless.
Whose mind should their speech be said to use?
Answer:
The speech uses the mind of the emanator.
Should the intermediate existence be said to be the four great elements or not the four great elements?
Answer:
The intermediate existence should be said to be the four great elements.
Should it be said to be form derived from the great elements or not form derived from the great elements?
Answer:
It should be said to be form derived from the great elements.
Should it be said to have mind or be mindless?
Answer:
It should be said to have mind.
Whose mind should its speech be said to use?
Answer:
Its speech should be said to use its own mind.
What is the name of the world?
Answer:
The name of the number of activities.
What is the name of the eon?
Answer:
The name of the number of months, half-months, spring, summer, and years.
What is the name of the arising, abiding, and ceasing of the mind?
Answer:
The name of the number of moments.
Are there any dharmas that arise from the four conditions?ğŸ”½Answer:
There are.
Do all mind and mental factors arise from three conditions?
Answer:
They arise.
Do the attainments of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and the sphere of endless consciousness arise from two conditions?
Answer:
They arise.
Do any dharmas not associated with the mind or form arise from one condition, excluding the attainments of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and the sphere of endless consciousness?
Answer:
They do not arise.
What are the dharmas that are associated with causes?
Answer:
All mind and mental factors.
What are the dharmas that are not associated with causes?
Answer:
Form, the unconditioned, and dharmas not associated with the mind.
What are the dharmas that are both associated with causes and not associated with causes?
Answer:
Those mind and mental factors are partially concomitant causes and partially non-concomitant causes.
How are dharmas neither concomitant causes nor non-concomitant causes?
Answer:
Those mind and mental factors are partially non-concomitant causes and partially neither concomitant causes nor non-concomitant causes.
What are dharmas with common objects?
Answer:
The mental factors associated with the various mental consciousnesses have objects.
What are dharmas without common objects?
Answer:
The various groups of five consciousnesses and their associated forms, unconditioned dharmas, and mental factors not directly associated with mind have objects.
What are dharmas with both common and uncommon objects?
Answer:

The various groups of five consciousnesses and their associated mental consciousnesses, and the mental factors associated with them, have objects. Forms, unconditioned dharmas, and mental factors not directly associated with mind have objects.
What are dharmas neither with common objects nor without common objects?
Answer:
Forms, unconditioned dharmas, and mental factors not directly associated with mind.
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
Internally without form perception, externally observing forms.
What is meant by internally without form perception, externally observing forms?
Answer:

Thus, this body will die, having died it will be discarded in the charnel ground, having been discarded in the charnel ground it will be buried in the ground, having been buried in the ground it will be eaten by various worms, having been eaten by various worms, one does not observe this body but only sees those various worms.

Thus, this body will die, having died it will be discarded in the charnel ground, having been discarded in the charnel ground it will be piled up as firewood, having been piled up as firewood it will be burned by fire, having been burned by fire, one does not observe this body but only sees the fire.

Thus, this body, like a heap of snow, coagulated milk, or ghee, will be placed on the fire, having been placed on the fire it will melt, having melted, one does not observe this body but only sees the fire.
Thus, internally without form perception, externally observing forms.
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
There is formless perception.
What is meant by formless perception?
Answer:

This body will die, having already died, will be discarded in the charnel ground, having already been discarded in the charnel ground, will be buried in the ground, having already been buried in the ground, will be eaten by various worms, having already been eaten by various worms, will be scattered in various places, having already been scattered in various places. They do not observe this body, nor do they see those various worms.ğŸ”½This body will die, having already died, will be discarded in the charnel ground, having already been discarded in the charnel ground, will be piled up as firewood, having already been piled up as firewood, will be burned by fire, having already been burned by fire, will be extinguished, having already been extinguished. They do not observe this body, nor do they see the fire.

This body, like a snow heap, coagulated milk, or ghee, will be placed on the fire, having already been placed on the fire, will melt and dissolve, having already melted and dissolved, will be extinguished, having already been extinguished. They do not observe this body, nor do they see the fire.
Thus there is the notion of formlessness.
Do all those who have form and the notion of formlessness have the complete cessation of form-related craving?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
All those with form and no perception have exhausted desire for form. Can there be those who have exhausted desire for form but are not formless and without perception?
Answer:
There are those who have exhausted desire for form but do not enter concentration.
All those who are formless and without perception have not yet exhausted desire for form?
Answer:
So it is.
All those who have not yet exhausted desire for form are formless and without perception. Can there be those who are formless and without perception but have not exhausted desire for form?
Answer:
There are those who have exhausted desire for form but do not enter concentration.
The four abodes of consciousness and the seven abodes of consciousness, are the four abodes of consciousness included in the seven abodes of consciousness?
Answer:
Either the four are not the seven.
How are the four not the seven?
Answer:

The form, feeling, perception, and mental formations of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, and the gods of the fruit of fruition, the feeling, perception, and mental formations of the gods of perception and non-perception - these are the four that are not the seven.
How are the seven not the four?
Answer:

The minds of humans and the heavens of the desire realm, the Brahmas, the Heaven of Merit-Born, the Heaven of Radiant Sound, the Heaven of Universal Purity, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of nothingness - these are the seven that are not the four.
What are the four and the seven?
Answer:

The form, feeling, perception, and volitional formations of humans and the heavens of the desire realm, the Brahmas, the Heaven of Merit-Born, the Heaven of Radiant Sound, the Heaven of Universal Purity, the feeling, perception, and volitional formations of the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of nothingness - these are the four and the seven.
What are not the four and not the seven?
Answer:
The minds of the hells, the minds of animals, hungry ghosts, the fruit-born, and the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception - these are not the four and not the seven.
Are the four bases of consciousness included in the nine abodes of beings?
Answer:
Either the four are not the nine.
What are the four that are not the nine?
Answer:

The form, feeling, perception, and mental formations of hell beings, the form, feeling, perception, and mental formations of animals, hungry ghosts, and non-percipient beings, are the four that are not the nine.
What are the nine that are not the four?
Answer:

The mind of humans and desire realm gods, the mind of Brahmas, the mind of the Heaven of Supreme Fruition, the mind of the Heaven of Universal Purity, the mind of non-percipient beings, and the mind of the formless realm, are the nine that are not the four.
What are the four that are the nine?
Answer:

The form, feeling, perception, and mental formations of humans and desire realm gods, the form, feeling, perception, and mental formations of Brahmas, the Heaven of Supreme Fruition, the Heaven of Universal Purity, and non-percipient beings, the feeling, perception, and mental formations of the formless realm, are the four that are the nine.
What are the four that are not the nine?
Answer:
The mind of hell beings, the mind of animals, hungry ghosts, and non-percipient beings, are the four that are not the nine.

Are the seven abodes of consciousness and the nine abodes of sentient beings included in the seven abodes of consciousness, or are the seven abodes of consciousness and the nine abodes of sentient beings included in the nine abodes of sentient beings?
Answer:
The nine are included in the seven, but the seven are not included in the nine.
What are not included?
Answer:
The two places of non-perception and the heaven of neither perception nor non-perception.
The third chapter on the truths of seeing is completed. The Sanskrit has 169 Å›lokas, the Qin has 2,912 words.

Chapter 4: Internal Creation, in the Abhidharma-mahÄ-vibhÄá¹£Ä-Å›Ästra, the fourth chapter on the four great elements. Internal four great elements, how many conditions are the internal four great elements for the internal four great elements? The internal four great elements are not the internal four great elements.
The internal four great elements are not the internal four great elements, how many conditions are the internal four great elements for the internal four great elements?

The causes and corresponding dharmas, how many conditions are the causes and corresponding dharmas for the causes and corresponding dharmas? The causes and corresponding dharmas are not the causes and corresponding dharmas.

Are the causes of the factors not concomitant with the mind causes of the factors not concomitant with the mind? Are the causes of the factors not concomitant with the mind causes of the factors concomitant with the mind? How many conditions are there?
Are the factors with objects the conditions for the factors with objects? How many conditions are there? Are the factors with objects the conditions for the factors without objects?
Are the factors without objects the conditions for the factors without objects? Are the factors without objects the conditions for the factors with objects? How many conditions are there?

Are the form factors the conditions for the form factors? How many conditions are there?ğŸ”½Are the form factors the conditions for the formless factors? Are the formless factors the conditions for the formless factors?
Are the formless factors the conditions for the form factors? How many conditions are there?
The same applies to the visible, invisible, resistant, and unresistant.
Are the defiled factors the conditions for the defiled factors? How many conditions are there? Are the defiled factors the conditions for the undefiled factors?
Are the undefiled factors the conditions for the undefiled factors? Are the undefiled factors the conditions for the defiled factors? How many conditions are there?
Are the conditioned factors the conditions for the conditioned factors? How many conditions are there? Are the conditioned factors the conditions for the unconditioned factors?
Are the unconditioned factors the conditions for the unconditioned factors? Are the unconditioned factors the conditions for the conditioned factors? How many conditions are there?
One who is bound by oneself to undergo the existence of hell beings obtains the faculties and four great elements of those hell beings.
How many conditions are the faculties and four great elements of those hell beings to those mind and mental factors?
How many conditions are those mind and mental factors to those faculties and four great elements?

One who is bound by oneself to undergo the existence of animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans obtains the faculties and four great elements of those animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans. How many conditions are those faculties and four great elements to those mind and mental factors of those animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans?
How many conditions are those mind and mental factors to those faculties and four great elements?

One born in the desire realm enters the first trance state with outflows, up to entering the attainment of neither perception nor non-perception with outflows. The faculties of those increase and benefit, and the four great elements increase and benefit those faculties. How many conditions are those four great elements to those mind and mental factors?
How many conditions are those mind and mental factors to those faculties and those four great elements?

One born in the desire realm enters the first trance state without outflows, up to entering the attainment of non-perception without outflows. The faculties and four great elements of those increase and benefit. How many conditions are those faculties and four great elements to those mind and mental factors?
Are those mind and mental factors the condition by way of object for those faculties and four great elements?

When one born in the form realm enters the first dhyÄna with outflows, up to entering the attainment of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, do those faculties and four great elements increase, and are those faculties and four great elements the condition by way of object for those mind and mental factors?
Are those mind and mental factors the condition by way of object for those faculties and four great elements?

When one born in the form realm enters the first dhyÄna without outflows, up to entering the attainment of non-perception, do those faculties and four great elements increase, and are those faculties and four great elements the condition by way of object for those mind and mental factors?
Are those mind and mental factors the condition by way of object for those faculties and four great elements?
What is the meaning of internal?
What is the meaning of not internal?
What is the meaning of feeling?
What is the meaning of not feeling?
What is the meaning of bondage?
What is the meaning of not bondage?
What is the meaning of the realm of views?
What is the meaning of not the realm of views?ğŸ”½Are those dharmas internal, those dharmas internal sense bases?
If dharmas are internal sense bases, are those dharmas internal?
Are all dharmas external included in the external sense bases? Are dharmas included in the external sense bases all external?
Are two feelings, three feelings, two feelings included in three feelings, or three feelings included in two feelings?

Two feelings, four feelings, five feelings, six feelings, eighteen feelings, thirty-six feelings, one hundred and eight feelings, are one hundred and eight feelings included in two feelings, or two feelings included in one hundred and eight feelings?
Up to thirty-six feelings, one hundred and eight feelings, are thirty-six feelings included in one hundred and eight feelings, or one hundred and eight feelings included in thirty-six feelings?

When using the unhindered path to approach the fruit of stream-entry, when realizing that cultivated path, how many of the four establishments of mindfulness are present and cultivated, how many are cultivated in the future, how many of the four right efforts, how many of the bases of spiritual power, how many of the faculties, how many of the powers, how many of the factors of awakening, how many of the factors of the path, how many of the meditative absorptions, how many of the liberations, how many of the form-less concentrations, how many of the bases of spiritual power, how many of the totalities, how many of the over-masteries, how many of the knowledges, how many of the concentrations are present and cultivated, how many are cultivated in the future? How many unhindered paths approach the fruits of once-returning and non-returning? The knowledge and insight of the supernormal powers, the knowledge and insight of the divine ear, the knowledge and insight of knowing the minds of others, the knowledge and insight of recollecting past lives, the knowledge and insight of the divine eye, and the knowledge and insight of the destruction of the contaminants?

When cultivating that path, how many of the four establishments of mindfulness are present and cultivated, how many are cultivated in the future, how many of the four right efforts, how many of the bases of spiritual power, how many of the faculties, how many of the powers, how many of the factors of awakening, how many of the factors of the path, how many of the meditative absorptions, how many of the liberations, how many of the form-less concentrations, how many of the bases of spiritual power, how many of the totalities, how many of the over-masteries, how many of the knowledges, how many of the concentrations are present and cultivated, how many are cultivated in the future?
Please explain the meaning of this chapter in full.ğŸ”½The internal four great elements are the cause and dominant condition of those internal four great elements.
The internal four great elements are the cause and dominant condition of the external four great elements.
The external four great elements are the cause and dominant condition of those external four great elements.
The external four great elements are the cause and dominant condition of the internal four great elements.
The factors associated with causes are the cause, immediate antecedent, condition, and dominant condition of those factors associated with causes.
The factors associated with causes are the cause and dominant condition of the factors not associated with causes, without an immediate antecedent.
The factors not associated with causes are the cause and dominant condition of those factors not associated with causes.
The factors not associated with causes are the cause, condition, and dominant condition of the factors associated with causes, without an immediate antecedent.
The factors with common objects are the cause, immediate antecedent, condition, and dominant condition of those factors with common objects.
The factors with common objects are the cause, immediate antecedent, and dominant condition of the factors without common objects, without a condition.
The dharmas without conditions are the cause and dominant condition of the dharmas without conditions.
The dharmas without conditions are the cause, condition, and dominant condition of the dharmas with conditions, but not the antecedent condition.
The form dharmas are the cause, condition, and dominant condition of the form dharmas.
The form dharmas are the cause, condition, and dominant condition of the formless dharmas, but not the antecedent condition.
The formless dharmas are the cause, antecedent condition, condition, and dominant condition of the formless dharmas.
The formless dharmas are the cause and dominant condition of the form dharmas, but not the condition or antecedent condition.
The visible, invisible, resistant, and unresistant are also like this.
The contaminated dharmas are the cause, antecedent condition, condition, and dominant condition of the contaminated dharmas.

The contaminated dharmas are the antecedent condition, condition, and dominant condition of the uncontaminated dharmas, but not the cause.ğŸ”½The uncontaminated dharmas are the cause, antecedent condition, condition, and dominant condition of the uncontaminated dharmas.
Here, cause means the cause, antecedent condition means the continuation, condition means the arising based on the above, and dominant condition means the continuation.
Uncontaminated dharmas are the immediate antecedent and supporting object conditions for contaminated dharmas, but have no cause.
Conditioned dharmas are the cause, immediate antecedent, supporting object, and dominant conditions for other conditioned dharmas.
Conditioned dharmas have no relation to unconditioned dharmas.
Unconditioned dharmas have no relation to other unconditioned dharmas.
Unconditioned dharmas are the supporting object and dominant conditions for other unconditioned dharmas.

Those who are bound to hell and experience the existence of hell receive the faculties and four great elements. Those faculties and four great elements are the dominant condition for those mind and mental factors.
Those mind and mental factors are the dominant condition for those faculties and four great elements.

Those who are bound to the existence of animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans receive the faculties and four great elements. Those faculties and four great elements are the dominant condition for those mind and mental factors.
Those mind and mental factors are the dominant condition for those faculties and four great elements.

If one is born in the desire realm and enters the first dhyÄna with impurity, up to entering the attainment of neither-perception-nor-non-perception with impurity, their faculties grow and benefit, the four great elements increase and benefit, those faculties and the four great elements are one dominant condition for those mind and mental factors;
those mind and mental factors are one dominant condition for those faculties and the four great elements.

If one is born in the desire realm and enters the first dhyÄna with purity, up to entering the attainment of non-perception with purity, their faculties grow and benefit, the four great elements increase and benefit, those faculties and the four great elements are one dominant condition for those mind and mental factors;
those mind and mental factors are one dominant condition for those faculties and the four great elements.

If one is born in the form realm and enters the first dhyÄna with impurity, up to entering the attainment of neither-perception-nor-non-perception with impurity, their faculties grow and benefit, the four great elements increase and benefit, those faculties and the four great elements are one dominant condition for those mind and mental factors;
those mind and mental factors are one dominant condition for those faculties and the four great elements.

If one is born in the form realm and enters the first dhyÄna without outflows, up to entering the concentration of non-use without outflows, their faculties grow and benefit, the four great elements increase and benefit, those faculties and the four great elements are one dominant condition for those mind and mental factors;
those mind and mental factors are one dominant condition for those faculties and the four great elements.
What is meant by internal?
Answer:
One's own enumeration.
What is meant by not internal?
Answer:
One's own non-enumeration.
What is meant by feeling?
Answer:
The enumeration of contaminated dharmas.
What is meant by not feeling?
Answer:
The enumeration of uncontaminated dharmas.
What is meant by bondage?
Answer:
The enumeration of contaminated dharmas.
What is meant by no bondage?
Answer:
The enumeration of uncontaminated dharmas.
What is meant by the realm of views?
Answer:
The enumeration of contaminated dharmas.
What is meant by not the realm of views?
Answer:
The enumeration of uncontaminated dharmas.
Are all dharmas internal, are those dharmas included in the internal sense bases?
Answer:
There are dharmas that are internal but not included in the internal sense bases.
What are the dharmas that are internal but not included in the internal sense bases?
Answer:
As explained, abiding in the contemplation of internal feelings and internal dharmas, these are dharmas that are internal but not included in the internal sense bases.
What are the dharmas that are included in the internal sense bases but not internal?
Answer:
As explained, abiding in the contemplation of the external body and the external mind, these are dharmas that are included in the internal sense bases but not internal.
What are the dharmas that are internal and also included in the internal sense bases?
Answer:
As explained, abiding in the contemplation of the internal body and the internal mind, these are dharmas that are internal and also included in the internal sense bases.
What are the dharmas that are not internal and also not included in the internal sense bases?
Answer:
As explained, abiding in the contemplation of the external feelings and external dharmas, these are dharmas that are not internal and also not included in the internal sense bases.
Are all dharmas external, are they included in the external sense bases?
Answer:
There are dharmas that are external but not included in the external sense bases.
What are the dharmas that are external but not included in the external sense bases?
Answer:
As explained, externally observing the external body and mind, these are dharmas that are external but not included in the external sense bases.
What are the dharmas that are included in the external sense bases but are not external?
Answer:
As explained, internally observing internal feelings and dharmas, these are dharmas that are included in the external sense bases but are not external.
What are the dharmas that are external and are included in the external sense bases?
Answer:
As explained, externally observing external feelings and dharmas, these are dharmas that are external and are included in the external sense bases.
What are the dharmas that are not external and are not included in the external sense bases?
Answer:
As explained, internally observing the internal body and mind, these are dharmas that are not external and are not included in the external sense bases.
Do two pains and three pains include each other?
Answer:
They include each other according to their types.
Do two pains and four pains, five pains, six pains, two pains include six pains, or do six pains include two pains?
Answer:
They include each other according to their types.
Do two pains and eighteen pains, two pains include eighteen pains, or do eighteen pains include two pains?
Answer:
Two include eighteen, but eighteen do not include two.
What do they not include?
Answer:
The painful faculty with outflows, the pleasant faculty associated with resistance, and the neutral faculty without outflows.
The same is true for thirty-six pains and one hundred and eight pains.
Up to six pains and eighteen pains, do six include eighteen, or do eighteen include six?
Answer:
Six include eighteen, but eighteen do not include six.
What do they not include?
Answer:
The faculty of pain is associated with the contaminated faculty of pleasure and the faculty of protection that is free from defilements.
The thirty-six pains and the one hundred and eight pains are also like this.
The eighteen pains and the thirty-six pains are also like this.
Do the thirty-six pains include the one hundred and eight, or do the one hundred and eight pains include the thirty-six?ğŸ”½Answer:
They are included according to their types.
